egg.name: Egg (Whole, Raw)

balanced.insight: Nature's perfect protein package with complete amino acids and essential nutrients
pros: Complete protein with all 9 essential amino acids
Rich in choline (147mg) for cell membrane health
High vitamin A (270 IU) for vision and immunity
Contains all B vitamins for metabolism

heart_health.insight: Nutrient-dense but high in dietary cholesterol - monitor intake if at risk
pros: Good unsaturated to saturated fat ratio (2.8:1)
cons: High cholesterol (186mg) may impact some individuals

muscle_building.insight: Complete protein with high leucine content for muscle protein synthesis
pros: High-quality protein (6.3g) with perfect amino acid score
Rich in leucine to trigger muscle growth
Contains vitamin D for muscle function
cons: Lower total protein than egg whites alone
Fat content may limit protein density in strict cuts

energy.insight: Sustained energy from healthy fats and complete protein
pros: B vitamins (especially B12 and riboflavin) support energy metabolism
cons: Very low in carbohydrates for immediate energy
Minimal iron (0.9mg) compared to red meat

weight_management.insight: High satiety with complete nutrition in minimal calories
pros: Excellent satiety score (88/100) keeps you full
Protein and fat slow gastric emptying
Rich in nutrients to prevent deficiency cravings
Low calorie density allows flexible portions
cons: Fat content adds calories vs. egg whites

brain_focus.insight: Brain superfood with choline for neurotransmitter production
pros: Choline converts to acetylcholine for memory and focus
Omega-3 DHA precursors support brain structure
Lutein and zeaxanthin protect cognitive function
cons: Lower in DHA than fatty fish

gut_health.insight: Easily digestible protein but lacks prebiotic fiber
pros: Highly bioavailable and easy to digest
Low FODMAP friendly for sensitive digestion
cons: High fat may trigger symptoms in some individuals

blood_sugar.insight: Perfect for blood sugar control with minimal carbs and high protein
pros: Nearly zero glycemic index - no blood sugar spike
Protein (6.3g) slows carb digestion in meals
Fat content further stabilizes glucose response
cons: No fiber to slow glucose absorption
Must pair with vegetables for complete meal

bone_joint.insight: Rich in bone-building vitamin D and phosphorus
cons: Low vitamin K (0.2mcg) for bone metabolism

anti_inflammatory.insight: Anti-inflammatory nutrients offset by omega-6 content
pros: Vitamin A (270 IU) modulates immune response
cons: Cholesterol may promote inflammation in some

bioavailability.notes: One of the most bioavailable protein sources (PDCAAS 1.0). Choline and lutein highly absorbable. Cook to improve protein digestibility and eliminate salmonella risk.

pairWith: Whole grain toast for complete breakfast
Leafy greens for iron absorption enhancement
Tomatoes for lycopene and vitamin C
Avocado for additional healthy fats
bestTiming: Evening meal for overnight protein synthesis

eggs.name: Eggs (2 Large, Raw)

balanced.insight: Complete nutrition from two eggs - protein, healthy fats, and essential micronutrients
pros: Complete protein (12.6g) with all essential amino acids
High vitamin A (540 IU) for immune function
Excellent vitamin B12 (0.89mcg) for nerve health
cons: Very high cholesterol (373mg) - 124% of daily limit

heart_health.insight: Nutrient-rich but high cholesterol requires moderation for at-risk individuals
pros: Favorable unsaturated to saturated fat ratio (2.9:1)
cons: Very high cholesterol (373mg) exceeds daily recommendations

muscle_building.insight: Optimal protein source with complete amino acids for muscle growth
pros: High-quality protein (12.6g) with perfect amino acid profile
Rich in leucine to maximize muscle protein synthesis
cons: Fat content reduces protein-to-calorie ratio vs. egg whites

energy.insight: Sustained energy from balanced fats and protein, though low in carbs
pros: Complete B vitamin complex supports energy metabolism
cons: Low iron (1.8mg) compared to red meat
No vitamin C to enhance iron absorption

weight_management.insight: High satiety with complete nutrition in only 143 calories per serving
pros: Healthy fats slow digestion and extend fullness
cons: Higher calories than egg whites alone
No fiber for additional satiety benefits
Fat content may not suit very low-fat diets

brain_focus.insight: Brain superfood with exceptional choline for memory and cognition
pros: Outstanding choline (294mg) - over half daily needs
Choline converts to acetylcholine for neurotransmission
Lutein and zeaxanthin cross blood-brain barrier
cons: Lower in DHA/EPA than fatty fish

gut_health.insight: Highly digestible protein but lacks gut-supporting fiber and probiotics
pros: Low FODMAP and gentle on sensitive stomachs
cons: Zero dietary fiber for microbiome health
High fat may cause discomfort in some
Lacks polyphenols to feed beneficial bacteria

blood_sugar.insight: Excellent for glucose control with minimal carbs and balanced protein
pros: Zero glycemic index prevents blood sugar spikes
Protein (12.6g) stabilizes glucose when paired with carbs
Healthy fats further slow glucose absorption
cons: No fiber to moderate glucose response
Requires pairing with vegetables for balanced nutrition
Very high protein may trigger gluconeogenesis

bone_joint.insight: Rich in vitamin D and phosphorus for bone health
pros: Vitamin D (2.2mcg) - 11% of daily needs for calcium absorption
cons: Low calcium (56mg) - only 5.6% of daily needs
Minimal vitamin K (0.3mcg) for bone metabolism

anti_inflammatory.insight: Contains anti-inflammatory nutrients but high omega-6 content
pros: Vitamin A (540 IU) modulates immune inflammation
cons: High omega-6 to omega-3 ratio (22:1) is pro-inflammatory
High cholesterol may increase inflammation in some

bioavailability.notes: Highest biological value protein source (PDCAAS 1.0). Choline, lutein, and zeaxanthin exceptionally bioavailable. Cooking improves protein digestibility and eliminates foodborne pathogens.

pairWith: Whole grain toast for balanced macros
Spinach or kale for iron and antioxidants
Bell peppers for vitamin C
Sweet potato for complex carbs
bestTiming: Breakfast for sustained morning energy and focus
Post-workout within 2 hours for muscle recovery
Evening meal for overnight protein synthesis

scrambled_egg.name: Scrambled Egg (1 Large, Cooked)

balanced.insight: Quick, nutritious breakfast with complete protein and healthy fats
pros: Complete protein (6.1g) with all essential amino acids
Rich in choline (169mg) for cellular health
High vitamin A (343 IU) for immune function
Quick to prepare and highly versatile
cons: Slightly higher calories than raw due to added fat

heart_health.insight: Nutrient-rich but higher in sodium and cholesterol than raw eggs
pros: Good unsaturated to saturated fat ratio (2.8:1)
cons: High cholesterol (169mg) - monitor if at risk
Higher sodium (171mg) from cooking with salt/butter
May contain trans fats if cooked in margarine

muscle_building.insight: Complete protein that's easy to digest for muscle recovery
pros: High-quality protein (6.1g) with complete amino acids
cons: Lower protein density than egg whites
Fat content from cooking reduces protein-to-calorie ratio

energy.insight: Steady energy from protein and fats without blood sugar crashes
pros: Balanced macros prevent energy spikes and crashes
cons: Very low carbohydrates for immediate energy
No vitamin C for iron absorption

weight_management.insight: Satisfying breakfast option with good protein-to-calorie ratio
pros: Good satiety score (85/100) keeps hunger at bay
Protein and fat slow gastric emptying
cons: Higher calories than plain boiled eggs
Added fats from cooking increase calorie density

brain_focus.insight: Excellent choline source for neurotransmitter synthesis and memory
pros: Choline converts to acetylcholine for focus
cons: Lower in DHA than fatty fish

gut_health.insight: Easily digestible but lacks fiber and may contain added fats
pros: Low FODMAP and gentle on digestion
cons: Added fats may irritate sensitive stomachs

blood_sugar.insight: Minimal impact on blood sugar with balanced protein and fats
cons: No fiber to moderate glucose response
Added butter may affect metabolic response

bone_joint.insight: Good source of vitamin D and phosphorus for bone health
cons: Low calcium (43mg) - only 4.3% of daily needs

anti_inflammatory.insight: Some anti-inflammatory nutrients but cooking may reduce benefits
pros: Vitamin A (343 IU) modulates immune response
cons: Cooking at high heat may create inflammatory compounds

bioavailability.notes: Cooking improves protein digestibility to ~91%. Heat-stable nutrients like protein and choline remain highly bioavailable. Gentle scrambling preserves nutrients better than high-heat frying.

pairWith: Whole wheat toast for fiber and complex carbs
Spinach for iron and antioxidants
Tomatoes for vitamin C and lycopene
Mushrooms for additional vitamin D

scrambled_eggs.name: Scrambled Eggs (2 Large, Cooked)

balanced.insight: Hearty breakfast with complete protein and essential nutrients
pros: Complete protein (12.2g) with all essential amino acids
High vitamin A (686 IU) for immunity
cons: Very high cholesterol (338mg) - 113% of daily limit
Higher calories from added cooking fats

heart_health.insight: Nutrient-rich but high cholesterol and sodium require moderation
pros: Good unsaturated to saturated fat ratio (2.9:1)
cons: Very high cholesterol (338mg) exceeds daily recommendations
High sodium (342mg) may raise blood pressure
May worsen lipid profile in hyper-responders

muscle_building.insight: Complete protein with excellent amino acid profile for recovery
pros: High-quality protein (12.2g) with complete amino acids
cons: Fat content reduces protein density vs. egg whites
Added fats increase calories without protein benefit

energy.insight: Sustained energy from balanced protein and fats
pros: Complete B vitamin complex for energy metabolism
cons: Very low carbohydrates (2.4g) for immediate energy
No vitamin C for iron absorption

weight_management.insight: High satiety but higher calories from cooking fats
cons: Added fats from butter/oil increase calorie density
Easy to overconsume with toast and sides

brain_focus.insight: Outstanding choline content for memory, focus, and cognitive health
pros: Exceptional choline (338mg) - over 60% of daily needs
Choline converts to acetylcholine for neurotransmission
Lutein and zeaxanthin support cognitive function
cons: Lower in DHA/EPA than fatty fish

gut_health.insight: Easily digestible but lacks fiber and may contain irritating fats
cons: Added fats may trigger symptoms in some
Lacks polyphenols to feed beneficial bacteria
High sodium may affect gut flora

blood_sugar.insight: Minimal blood sugar impact but pair with vegetables for balance
cons: Added butter may affect metabolic response

bone_joint.insight: Good vitamin D and phosphorus for bone mineralization
cons: Low calcium (86mg) - only 8.6% of daily needs
Minimal vitamin K (0.6mcg) for bone metabolism

anti_inflammatory.insight: Contains anti-inflammatory nutrients but high omega-6 and cooking may reduce benefits
pros: Vitamin A (686 IU) modulates immune inflammation
cons: High-heat cooking may create inflammatory AGEs

bioavailability.notes: Scrambling improves protein digestibility to ~91% compared to raw. Choline and B vitamins remain highly bioavailable. Avoid high heat to prevent oxidation of cholesterol and fats.

pairWith: Whole grain toast for complete breakfast
Spinach or arugula for iron and antioxidants
Bell peppers for vitamin C
Avocado for additional healthy fats and fiber
bestTiming: Breakfast for sustained morning energy and focus

boiled_egg.name: Boiled Egg (1 Large, Hard or Soft)

balanced.insight: Clean, simple protein source with maximum nutrient retention from gentle cooking
pros: Complete protein (6.3g) with all essential amino acids
Rich in choline (147mg) for cell membrane health
High vitamin A (260 IU) for immune function

heart_health.insight: Gentle cooking preserves heart-healthy nutrients without added fats
pros: Good unsaturated to saturated fat ratio (2.5:1)
Low sodium (62mg) supports blood pressure control
cons: High cholesterol (186mg) may impact some individuals

muscle_building.insight: Optimal protein source with complete amino acids and excellent digestibility
pros: High-quality protein (6.3g) with perfect amino acid score
Boiling preserves leucine for muscle protein synthesis
cons: Fat content reduces protein-to-calorie ratio vs. egg whites

energy.insight: Sustained energy from balanced protein and healthy fats
pros: Stable energy without blood sugar crashes
cons: Very low carbohydrates (0.6g) for immediate energy
Low iron (0.6mg) compared to red meat
No vitamin C for iron absorption

weight_management.insight: Perfect weight loss food with high satiety and minimal calories
pros: Excellent satiety score (89/100) keeps you full
No added fats or oils from cooking
Portable and convenient for meal prep
cons: No fiber for additional satiety benefits

brain_focus.insight: Brain superfood with choline for memory and cognitive performance
pros: Choline converts to acetylcholine for focus and memory
Lutein and zeaxanthin cross blood-brain barrier
cons: Lower in DHA/EPA than fatty fish

gut_health.insight: Highly digestible with gentle cooking, though lacks fiber
pros: Boiling is gentlest cooking method for digestion
Low FODMAP and easy on sensitive stomachs
No added fats to irritate digestion
cons: Lacks polyphenols to feed beneficial bacteria

blood_sugar.insight: Perfect for blood sugar control with minimal carbs and no added fats
pros: Zero glycemic index - no blood sugar spike
Protein (6.3g) stabilizes glucose when paired with carbs
No added sugars or starches from cooking
cons: No fiber to moderate glucose response

bone_joint.insight: Good vitamin D and phosphorus for bone health
cons: Low calcium (25mg) - only 2.5% of daily needs
Minimal vitamin K (0.1mcg) for bone metabolism

anti_inflammatory.insight: Better anti-inflammatory profile than fried eggs due to gentle cooking
pros: Vitamin A (260 IU) modulates immune response

bioavailability.notes: Boiling improves protein digestibility to 91-95% while preserving heat-sensitive nutrients. Choline, lutein, and B vitamins remain highly bioavailable. Gentle cooking method prevents oxidation of cholesterol.

pairWith: Whole grain toast for balanced breakfast
Leafy greens for iron and antioxidants
Tomatoes for vitamin C and lycopene
Hummus for fiber and healthy fats
bestTiming: Snack for portable protein between meals

fried_egg.name: Fried Egg (1 Large)

balanced.insight: Classic preparation with good protein but added fats increase calories

Rich in choline (147mg) for cellular health
High vitamin A (335 IU) for vision and immunity
cons: Added fats from cooking oil increase calories

pros: Good unsaturated to saturated fat ratio (2.9:1)
cons: High cholesterol (184mg) may impact lipid profile
Possible trace trans fats (0.02g) from frying

muscle_building.insight: Complete protein but added fats reduce protein density
pros: High-quality protein (6.3g) with complete amino acids
cons: Added fats increase calories without protein benefit
Lower protein-to-calorie ratio than boiled eggs

energy.insight: Sustained energy from protein and fats but watch cooking oil quality
cons: Very low carbohydrates (0.4g) for immediate energy

bioavailability.notes: Frying improves protein digestibility to ~90%. However, high heat may oxidize cholesterol and reduce heat-sensitive vitamins like folate. Use gentle heat and quality oils (olive, avocado) to minimize nutrient loss.

Sauted spinach for iron and antioxidants
Avocado slices for healthy fats and fiber
Cherry tomatoes for vitamin C and lycopene
bestTiming: Post-workout if using healthy cooking oil
